explain: a person or family who lives near or next to your home
an insect that is related to a grasshopper
how fast or slow something moves
to use a tool to find out how tall or heavy something is
the number that comes after seven
to put food in your mouth and swallow it
an event where things are sold at lower prices
a piece of cloth attached to a boat to catch wind and make the boat move
statement: New neighbors just moved into the house across the street.
The rooster crows early in the morning.
Patrick's tarantula likes to eat bugs and hide inside his mother's slippers!
Roger's cricket eats leaves from the garden.
Juice pours at a faster speed than honey.
This snail is so slow that it takes a long time to go anywhere!
The nurse will measure my height once a year.
Can you count from one to eight?
The dog ate all the food in his bowl.
The store has a big sale on shoes this weekend.
The boat moved quickly when we raised the sail.
